channel.title: info on Philomath's Lair!
channel.description: Recent content in info on Philomath's Lair!

item.title: Weechat relaying
item.description: Elitebnc after being in service for more than 5 years, is shut in January 2020 and many ghosts who was relying on Elitebnc bouncer to exist, were being exorcised. IRC all the way? (how to remain online on IRC everysecond) Bouncers? I was on elitebnc for quite sometime, until they shut down Why not quassel or IRCcloud? Maxking wrote a post on persistent irc setup and shared his reasons to use weechat over everything else.

item.title: Apache.Nginx
item.description: Web servers What are they, why and how options apache and nginx comparison https://www.nginx.com/blog/nginx-vs-apache-our-view/ https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/apache-vs-nginx-practical-considerations Draft: configuring apache web server on March 14, 2018

item.title: GDB is your saviour
item.description: What is a bug? It is a feature. History of bugs Share your bugs: https://youtu.be/h4pZZOmv4Qs what is a debugger why need one? what are the options ​ gdb is open source How to use gdb, a cool looking terminal based debugger? drafted since: 11 march 2018 baobab, diceware, and locate!

item.title: How Linux System Boots up!
item.description: Power on BIOS: points to the bootloader (to multple select OS and to add more features) Loads kernel ​ run level 1: looks for devices through I/O ports (autoprobing) ​ handle control to Init Init Process ​ Check for filesystem and disk failures ​ start several daemons such as www server and print server ​ starts getty program to watch keyboards and mount inputs ​ daemons to support network services and x server.

item.title: Make Files!
item.description: Make Files What are makefiles? you worker who will do tha job for you and for free even :P, same goes for CI, CD pipeline while working, corercting completing my freshman year project of c based text editor, I realized I should Upgrade my coding style to incorporate makefiles to be a efficient coder. So, before all the intricate details, on how to use makefiles, syntax and all. Let’s start with what it is first and why you should even care about it.

item.title: Mysterious language of Bash!
item.description: About $# variables and fork bomb in bash How cryptic they are and link to the documentation and stack overflow. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5163144/what-are-the-special-dollar-sign-shell-variables

item.title: The Digital Pigeon
item.description: Ever wonder how To know more how email system works in reality, in bits and bytes, read about the digital pigeon! Thanks to sayan at making these concepts more palpable at Pycon India 2018. if you also wonder about how things work, you might like my other blogs on the same. How dns works? How Internet works How linux boots How encryption works? It’s just multiplexing

item.title: Use your Ram wisely!
item.description: Limiting Ram usage by browsers using cgroups when I was running my old p4 system on 1 gb ram. I have been using my 12 year old pentium 4 processor computer with 1.5GB ram and 1 GB of swap for last month with debian 9. It works smooth, way smoother than Windows equivalent. But here’s a glitch, as soon as I start browsing, the memory consumption reaches the highest peak. My system starts to hang and slow down as long the browser is open.

item.title: Podcasts?
item.description: Learning is what keep us alive. Learning should be an ongoing quest for everyone and never be put to rest in their life till the end of time. Why Podcast matter to you? Ever wanted to learn something new, to remain indulged in your passion with your day job? Make best use of your time but you don’t get any? No worries, Podcast has come to rescue you. WIth the busy daily life, we all have to live, we need to do multiple jobs at once and Face it, we are not best keeping up with all!
